description:
Job Description 


 The Sage50 Inbound team is responsible for handling all incoming sales related calls. We sell to all various customer demographics from existing to new clients with a strong focus on tailoring the needs of our customers with the right solution. Team members are a strong part of our culture and we continuously turn to them for their contributions and feedback. Learn the skills to adapt and connect with various customer demographics and gain a better understanding on how various businesses operate. If you’re looking for an exciting environment that is fast-paced, rewarding, competitive with opportunities for personal and professional growth, Apply Now.


 Key Responsibilities 



 Manage conversations to prospective accounts (incoming phone calls and web chats)to build a relationship, determine needs for the product, upsell or cross-sell opportunities

 Meet or exceed defined monthly sales quota

 Identify customer needs and establish value by presenting how Sage could be a possible solution to the decision-maker.

 Manage customer questions and potential concerns

 Document all sales activity and provide management with updates as required

 Maintain professional internal and external relationships

 Maintain an accurate pipeline of sales opportunities

 Manage time appropriately to ensure that SPE productivity standards and KPIs are met on a regular basis

 Understand competitive offerings and counter strategies

 Build and sustain a high level of customer satisfaction

 Demonstrate ability to achieve and exceed revenue targets




Qualifications




 Excellent communication skills in writing, speaking, and listening

 Minimum of 1 years experience in B2B sales, value based solution sales, telemarketing, outbound sales, inbound sales, account management or business development in high tech or SaaS industry

 High School Diploma or equivalent work experience required; Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Marketing or Technology preferred

 Proven ability to converse with and influence decision makers

 Experience in MS Office Suite, Word and Excel, MS Outlook, Fusion Order Entry, CRM tools like Salesforce

 Ability to multi-task and work independently in a fast-paced environment

 Strong organizational skills including prioritizing, time management, and ability to meet deadlines

 Proven track record of success in a high volume/transactional sales environment

Courtier en pharmacie bien établi est à la recherche d’un(e) représentant(e) pour les régions de Montréal et West-Island.

Habiletés recherchés :

- Capacité de travailler plusieurs marques;
- Autonomie et rigueur;
- Débrouillardise et sens de l’optimisation.

Expérience dans le domaine de la pharmacie un atout.

Salaire concurrentiel + allocation au KM + avantages sociaux

Well established Broker for pharmacie retail is currently seeking a sales representative to cover Montreal and West-Island regions.

Skills required :

- Ability to represent several brands;
- Independence and discipline;
- Resourcefulness and optimization.

Experience in the pharmacy industry an asset 

Competitive remuneration + KM allowance + benefits

Our client provides customers with high-quality wire and cable products at the best value possible. As one of Canada’s largest distributors for over 40 years, they have built a reputation for going to great lengths for their customers. They supply solutions for a variety of different markets in residential, commercial, industrial and emerging green markets such as wind farms, solar energy, hydroelectric, water and waste treatments.





Why Join them?



You will be joining a market leader with over 40 years of experience to help you elevate your potential.

You will be working for the world’s #1 privately held business-to-business distributor of electrical products and related solutions.

Be part of an ISO-certified company with a strong quality assurance program and new technologies which help you perform at your best.

Attractive compensation with benefits and “other perks” such as tuition reimbursement.

Employee Referral provides the opportunity to earn more while you work by referring one of the best you know.

In-depth process and product training provided by a mentoring approach, product knowledge sessions hosted by the Product Manager and lunch and learn meetings.

They house the largest inventory to better serve their customers and deliver on sales commitments.






Responsibilities



Contacting current customers (via email and phone) and identifying new products and potential up-selling.

Responding to and processing incoming calls and orders.

Opening new accounts.

Developing customer base and sales lead by making cold and warm calls.

Entering orders into the system.

Maintaining knowledge base on current products and learning about new products.

Providing pricing quotations and follow-up on quotes.

Credits/Debits.

Returns – as required.

Providing technical support on products.

Provide quotations and product information.

Troubleshooting [freight problems, expediting, etc…].

Responding to inquiries.

Identify, develop and close business opportunities.






Requirements:



A minimum of 3-4 years of sales experience.

A background in selling industrial and commercial products is an asset. Product knowledge or industry experience preferred.

Strong understanding of solution selling vs. price.

The role includes a strong understanding of sales margins, product sourcing, pricing and negotiations.

The candidate must show progressive sales accomplishments.

Strong business acumen and professional approach to offering effective services and solutions.

Post-Secondary courses in Sales and/or Marketing preferred.

High School Diploma required.

Knowledge of Microsoft Office required.

CRM experience preferred.






Compensation:



Strong base salary and uncapped commission

RRSP matching and tuition reimbursement

Medical, dental and vision benefits





Are you the person they are looking for? Get in touch with me and apply now. 





We thank all applicants, however, only those who meet the criteria and live in the Lower Mainland will be contacted.

industries: Construction, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services
description:
Outside Sales Representative – Award Winning Company



UniFirst is an international leader in the $18 billion dollar garment services industry. We currently employ 14,000 Team Partners who serve 300,000 business customer locations throughout the U.S., Canada, and Europe. We are rated in the top 10 “Best Companies to Sell For” list by Selling Power magazine and recognized on Forbes magazine’s “Platinum 400 – Best Big Companies” list. As an 80-year old company focused on annual growth, there’s never been a better time to join our outside sales team.

We’re currently seeking a motivated, self-driven individual as an Outside Sales Representative to increase new account sales in a dedicated market territory. The successful candidate will be responsible for identifying new opportunities and following up on potential leads utilizing an award-winning sales process. If you have prior sales experience and a desire to expand your career, we want to hear from you.


UniFirst offers everything you need to excel as an Outside Sales Representative:



Competitive base salary 

Uncapped monthly commissions 

Monthly bonus 

Protected territory 

Industry leading sales training 

Car and cell phone allowances 

Cutting edge sales tools, including a data management device with CRM software 

Work-life balance (no nights or weekends) 

Full range of benefits including RRSP + company match and profit sharing; vision, dental, health, and life insurance; tuition reimbursement; and more 




Responsibilities




Acquire new business accounts in your specified territory 

Develop sales strategies and maintain high productivity levels 

Call on businesses in person, from major corporations to small companies 

Conduct presentation meetings with potential clients as needed 

Negotiate sales contracts and oversee new account installations 




Qualifications




Outside business-to-business sales experience preferred (will train the right candidate) 

High school diploma required, Bachelor’s degree preferred 

Exceptional communication, negotiation, and time management skills 

Proficiency with computer, Microsoft Office Suite, internet, and CRM 

Valid driver’s license and reliable transportation 




A Career With UniFirst Offers




Sales Training: With the most in-depth training platform in the industry, our employees get top quality skills training designed to enhance their performance and assist them with their career potential and advancement. 

Career Mobility: You may quickly find yourself on the fast-track to success. We’re a growing company offering significant avenues for personal development and growth, and providing for continued career progression. You set your personal goals and control your income, as well as your future growth. A UniFirst career can take you as far as you want to go. 

Tools and Programs: UniFirst’s many cutting edge sales tools and innovative programs are designed with one purpose in mind – to help you succeed. 

Fun Family Culture: UniFirst sales representatives enjoy what they do and have fun doing it. Our unique family-like culture is what makes UniFirst an organization that stands out from the rest. 

Diversity: At UniFirst, you'll find an environment brimming with different cultures, personalities, and backgrounds because we know it takes many kinds of people to make us successful. 


We offer a competitive base salary, monthly commission, monthly bonus, and an industry leading benefits package that includes: RRSP + company match and profit sharing, health and life insurance, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), disability coverage, vacation, sick time, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, 30% employee discounts, and more.


UniFirst is Proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer


UniFirst is an equal employment/affirmative action employer. If you need accommodation for any part of the application process because of a medical condition or disability, please send an e-mail to TalentAcquisition@unifirst.com or call (978) 658-8888 to let us know the nature of your request.

Reporting directly to the VP GALLEON, the Luxury Specialist will be responsible to increase our business in the luxury/high end sales segment. He or she will manage some current customers and will also be responsible to develop new business opportunities in on trade channel, as well as with private and corporate customers.





Responsibilities



Build relationship and manage the Dandurand Group's high-end wines and spirits with strategic customer and partner accounts mainly located in Toronto (licensed accounts, private and corporate customers) 

Identify and build new business partnerships that contribute to sales, profits and recruitment of private and corporate clients

Actively contribute to the development and implementation of promotional strategies and tools to promote the GALLEON brand and ensure its high-end positioning

Build strong and lasting business relationships with buyers, sommeliers and prescribers

Remain focused on superior customer satisfaction throughout all stages of the sales cycle 

Successfully execute promotions and programs to develop distribution

Identify the needs of the luxury market in Toronto

Aggressively grow market share and presence of licensed companies by creatingquality partnerships that match our partner brands.

Host private events related to the discovery of wines and spirits

Manage a marketing support budget for partners.






Education and experiences


 


WSET3 certification or sommelier diploma

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or equivalent

Two (2) years experience in a sales role

Experience in the wine industry (major asset)









Skills



Excellent knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite (in particular Excel and PowerPoint)

 Kbowledge of CRM tools

Highly developed interpersonal and leadership skills

Excellent communication skills

 Strong planning and organizational skills

 Proven ability to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines

Ability to attend evening and weekend events

Must have a car and a valid driver's license

Bilingualism is essential

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Internet Publishing
description:
As a Sales Development Representative at Moveworks, you’ll be the voice that shares our game-changing AI technology with the world’s leading companies. Alongside the Sales Development Manager, you’ll define our outreach strategy — determining the most powerful approaches to identify and create qualified opportunities for our Account Executives. Moveworks is using AI and machine learning to transform how companies support their employees, and this role will challenge you to continually learn how we provide value to our customers.

Those customers speak for themselves: Slack, LinkedIn, DocuSign, HP, Gap, Verizon, and Broadcom, just to name a few. But before they became customers — and before they began saving more than a million dollars each year with Moveworks — they were prospects. It all starts with you, the Sales Development Representative, when you reach out to the right IT leader, at the right company, with the right messaging. You understand that sales is a unique blend of science and art, and you’re ready to apply your experience at an AI startup that’s doubled its revenue and customer base in each of the last three years.


Who we are:


Moveworks is revolutionizing how companies support their employees — with the first AI platform that makes getting help at work effortless. Using advanced conversational AI built for the enterprise, Moveworks gives employees exactly what they need, from IT support to HR help to policy information. Our platform allows customers like DocuSign, Twitter, Snowflake, Instacart, Coca Cola, and Hearst to move forward on what matters.

Founded in 2016, Moveworks has raised $315 million in funding, at a valuation of $2.1 billion. We’ve been named to the Forbes AI 50 list for three consecutive years, while earning recognition as the Best Chatbot Solution at the 2021 AI Breakthrough Awards. Above all, we’ve built an AI company that puts people first, which is why Built In named Moveworks the #1 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area.


What you’ll do:



Generate outbound leads, drive attendance to our webinars and events, and qualify inbound inquiries to build pipeline for our Account Executives

Prospect creatively, with a focus on phone, email, and social media (Linkedin Twitter, etc.) 

Achieve and exceed monthly targets for meetings, lead creation, and pipeline generated

Continually learn the new ways that Moveworks delivers instant support to employees — while saving service desks time and money

Be a key player in weekly team meetings to discuss challenges and celebrate wins 




What you bring to the table:



1-2 years of software sales development experience 

Experience using sales automation tools, such as Outreach or Salesloft 

Experience using Salesforce and LinkedIn Sales Navigator 

A history of meeting or exceeding monthly targets 

A deep passion for sales and the sales process 

A knack for organization and the ability to manage data

A growth mindset and deep curiosity about technology and/or AI

A proven power of persuasion needed to overcome objections

WHO WE ARE


EA Associates is a bespoke model Talent Acquisition Consultancy, specializing in the recruitment of Life Science professionals across Canada, US, UK, Australia, Ireland & the Philippines, with specific focus in the areas of Pharmaceuticals, Biotech Engineering & Healthcare.




Our client is looking for a high-energy, self-motivated individual to join a team of other qualified energetic professionals interested in helping to grow business through value-based conversations and remarkable customer experience. If you are a motivated self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment, then this is your opportunity for a rewarding career with excellent income and growth potential. 





Responsibilities: 


• Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services. 

• Provide prompt, accurate, and friendly customer service. Service can include responding to inquiries regarding insurance availability, eligibility, coverages, policy changes, transfers, claim submissions, and billing clarification. 

• Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals. 





Requirements: 


• Sales experience (outside sales or inside sales representative, retail sales associate, or telemarketing) preferred 

• Successful track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred 

• Excellent interpersonal skills 

• Excellent communication skills - written, verbal and listening 

• Proactive in problem solving 

• Dedicated to customer service 

• Ability to multi-task 

• Property & Casualty license (preferred/must be able to obtain 

 • OTL & LLQP (preferred/must be able to obtain) 






Our clients are equal opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.









 
As part of the interview process, and to comply with regulations and guidelines, your resume and interview notes shall be kept on file


.
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description:
About the job


At Vantage Canada, we offer world-class training and an experience that is unique and rewarding. Vantage Canada is looking for the next sales superstar to join our team in 2022.




Our staff has the opportunity to live in some of Canada's most beautiful cities in our staff accommodations (Kelowna, Calgary, Edmonton, or Halifax). Our professional hands-on training is done daily, so you’ll finish your summer not only with unmatched income, but a new skill set for your future career. We provide fully furnished apartments/housing (rent free) and give students the opportunity to earn a higher than average summer income (our 2021 average earnings per student was $17, 500 over the course of the four-month summer). You will have the opportunity to learn how to perfect a sales presentation, drastically improve your communication skills and the trajectory of your career with some of the most respected names in the industry, and apply these skills in live customer presentations daily.




As such we look for highly accomplished, extremely motivated individuals who are not looking to just pass the summer by, but rather want to maximize their earnings, travel within Canada, and gain valuable and transferable business skills.




Vantage Canada hires only the most ambitious students. This connects you with like-minded peers and creates a new valuable network of friends and business colleagues. This job also allows you to travel, should you so choose, as many of our sales reps work in a different province each month. Those who prefer to stick closer to home can also do so.




Vantage Canada sales reps come back to school in the fall with a new set of business and interpersonal skills that are simply not taught in university. In this job, you will be performing thousands of sales presentations to a very diverse group of people across major cities in Canada. Our reps come back with a new level of confidence and ability to communicate with people of all ages and backgrounds.




Nervous about doing presentations in class? You won't be after a summer with Vantage!




If you are truly interested in setting yourself apart, living, and exploring our beautiful country, all while gaining financial freedom, then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.




The PERFECT person for our program is the person who:




Has outstanding people skills, is out-going, socially strong and is well-liked by peers.




Comes from a competitive background i.e. sports/dance, etc.




Is extrinsically motivated and hardworking




Is adventurous and outgoing and has either has done some traveling or wishes to




Is motivated by money and/or by competition.

Join us at Vinyl and represent some of the most incredible brands and companies! We are looking for focused and determined individuals that are aiming to exceed in their career. If this is you, your hard work and ambition combined with our top training programs will establish you for long term career success. Our business model is unique in that there’s 0% seniority, and 100% progression from within. We’re confident you will become a leader in no time, building your own team to continue expanding our campaigns, therefore driving further business development and greater personal opportunity. 





Job Responsibilities:



Work hard in daily team environments to sharpen sales and communication skill sets

Represent our clients well by providing the best customer service

Create engaging conversations around our client’s and their products/services

Secure sales, hitting daily targets and reporting thorough data to leadership and internal client contacts

Create ambitious weekly goals and achieve them



Rewarding Benefits:



Excellent compensation and commissions

Top level leadership training and development

Vast network of successful business professionals 

Expedited career progression

Bonuses and incentives

Multiple travel opportunities 



Our Commitment: 



Provide excellent ongoing training

Networking opportunities

Creating lively, competitive team environments

Supporting your goals and helping you achieve them





Apply today to start achieving your career goals! No former experience is required

Mentimeter’s vision is to transform presentations and meetings into fun and interactive experiences by making it easy to listen and to be heard. We believe in giving everyone a voice, in every meeting and presentation. We are building a modern, friendly, and diverse product-first tech company with HQ based in Stockholm and now, we are looking for a Senior Sales Development Representative (SDR) / Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our team in our brand new office in Toronto, Canada.




As a Senior Sales Development Representative, you’ll focus on- and lead operations in various outbound campaigns to generate new business opportunities. You will also focus on the development of each qualified lead to pass to your team of Account Executives and Relationship Managers.




As Senior SDR in the Toronto-team, your primary focus will be customers in the United States and Canada, but as a team, we also manage the Americas.

We are looking for a colleague with experience, a track record, high energy, an entrepreneurial tempo, and the ability to work closely with our marketing and product colleagues, with a strong focus on business opportunities and sales. The ideal candidate is someone who can start relationships with some of the largest companies in the world - and move them from being loving Mentimeter users to large Enterprise customers.




We are referencing the Dropbox and Slack journeys when we see the future of Mentimeter. Mentimeter is a service that is loved globally and our growth has been almost 100% organic. Sales are currently growing over 10% per month and you will be a driving force to accelerate that growth even further!




We believe that a person with the right ambition can really leverage their time at Mentimeter. We are growing fast, and with us, so can you. Most importantly, we are looking for a candidate who is eager to develop Mentimeter as a company to a world-leading position. You will be one of the leading individuals making this happen.





Responsibilities for the role:



Qualify leads based on our user, presenter and customer databases

Deal with enterprises on a global level with customers such as Unilever and Uber, in more than 220 countries

Present and hand-over qualified leads to Account Executives and Relationship Managers

Work closely and collaboratively with Account Executives and Relationship Managers to develop and implement appropriate prospecting strategies

Conduct high volume prospecting to qualify leads through calls, emails, social media, and other channels

Identify the needs and challenges of the prospective customer

Maintain strong relationships with SMarketing (Sales+Marketing) team, leveraging campaigns to aid in outbound reach out

Collaboratively drive initiatives, experiments and projects with new approaches to grow our cold and warm outbound efforts

Continuously improve the processes, analysis, and tactics used by Mentimeter Sales

Continuously support the improvement of SDR/BDR area






Resources we have to support you:



Many (200+ million) users, presenters and customers who love Mentimeter (we have a NPS of above 70)

Professional CRM and data gathering services (Salesforce, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Intercom etc.) for advanced analytics and segmentation

World-class lead-generation from the Marketing and Product teams

Marketing and Sales teams to support in analysis and tactics

Mentimeter principles / ways-of-working






Compensation model:


We strongly believe in the power of together, and we put a lot of effort into collaboration, teamwork and helping each other whenever needed. We believe that every part of Mentimeter, from Sales Development Representatives and Account Executives to Frontend developers and marketing managers contribute equally to our continued success. To foster and emphasize this culture and way of working, we apply a 
non-commission based salary model
 in our sales roles, which has proven to be very successful and appreciated across the team.





Must haves for the role:



Minimum 2 year experience (full-time) in a successful pre-sales position with proven track record

Experience in selling SaaS

Experience as an SDR/BDR

Valuable experience ranging from either prospecting leads, cold-calling, qualifying leads, driving an entire sales process, closing new business, researching good fit organisations and/or data-driven market research

Ability and some experience assessing business opportunities using data for informative decision making

Post-secondary education (field not important)

An entrepreneur in spirit and sales person by proof, as you will be part of building Mentimeter as a company together with all your colleagues

Ambitious and result-oriented

Flexible mindset and open to new ways of working

You are required to have professional level English - we sell to 220+ countries globally today

Excellent communication skills is a must when communicating with external customers and internal stakeholders

Permanent residency and/or eligible to work in Toronto, Canada.






It's a bonus if you have:



Bachelor or Masters degree (field not important)

Fluency in Spanish and/or Portuguese






The recruitment process consists of:



Personality test and logical ability test

Introduction Interview

Business Case

Competence Interview

Culture Interview





Mentimeter is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment, assessment and selection processes in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act and the Human Rights Code. If you require accommodations during the application and hiring processes, please notify us and we will work with you on suitable accommodation(s), to the point of undue hardship.

industries: Software Development and Human Resources Services
description:
Talentsoft (a Cegid Company) is an international group of more than 3,600 employees in more than 20 countries supporting professionals in expertise accounting, payroll and human resources (HCM), ERP, tax and retail. Cegid is a leader in HR Payroll, Talentsoft is a leader in Human Capital and Talent Management. Talentsoft (a Cegid Company) develops useful and innovative management solutions for its clients to become their preferred partner by understanding their business and challenges so that clients can turn their challenges into opportunities. Each of our employees comes to work with an entrepreneurial spirit and the flexibility to try new things, work with innovative technologies and integrate corporate social responsibility directly into their work.




If you are open to a challenging role in a market with very strong growth potential and a wide range of development opportunities within our company, please find detailed information about the position attached.






Mission



You want to work in an international HR Software environment? Do you want to join an innovative and fast growing company? If you would like to proactively shape sales at Talentsoft (A Cegid Company) and convince potential new customers to work with our innovative software solutions, then this is the right opportunity for you. This position will be based in Montreal, Canada. (Hybrid working mode)






Your role:







Development and implementation of strategies for outbound lead generation

Research, identification and active approach of new potential customers

Determination and clarification of the requirements or challenges of our target group and mediation of the first solutions for the digitization of HR processes

Building relationships to establish an active dialogue with decision makers of our target customers

Passing qualified leads to the Account Executive

Responsible for growing Talentsofts (a Cegid Company) prospect pipeline, generating leads and identifying sales opportunities

Telephone cold calling of potential target customers in the area of products and services requiring explanation

Structured market research, lead generation and qualification

Processing and manage relevant customer data in our CRM system


 

 



Your Profile:







Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Communications or equivalent

You already have experience in exchange with customers, preferably in the B2B area in an HR software company or equivalent solution selling industry (eg: call center, human resources, event management, etc.)

You are passionate about software products and ready to work with them

You identify yourself as an active listener who communicates purposefully and confidently and is always proactive

You can create trust and enthusiasm with potential customers through your positive, energetic and creative way

Aptitude for technology, including using web based software and internet tools

Highly motivated individual with a strong drive for target achievement

Fast comprehension and reliability

You demonstrate great presentation and communication skills in written and spoken French and English


 



WHAT WE OFFER 






At Talentsoft (a Cegid Company) you will find a fast-paced environment with a driven, smart and international team. With us you get the chance to bring in your own ideas and make a real impact. In addition to that, we work with the latest tools and the best colleagues.





Flexible working hours & home office

Competitive salaries

Steep learning curve and great responsibility

Agile environment

Latest technology

Trainings and continuous development

Promotion of own ideas

Trusting & fair collaborations

30 days paid holiday

Company pension scheme

Fruit, snacks and drinks

Regular and fun team events

Modern office in the heart of Montreal








We are looking forward to receiving your application!

Job Description


One of our exclusive & prestigious client in the construction designing industry, is seeking a sales representative to join their growing team on a full time, permanent basis in the Ottawa region! This candidate should have strong technical skills in residential construction along with construction sales experience. You will be the first point of contact for the company whilst being responsible for the coordination with designers, clients and the build team to ensure project success! Additionally, this opportunity offers a very competitive salary including commission and benefits! If you are looking to do something differently in the construction industry, this may be the right opportunity for you!





Roles and Responsibilities



Respond & evaluate new sales opportunities, inquiries and potential leads

Setup initial meetings with prospective clients, visit sites, and collect information pertinent to the project

Prepare & present design documents/agreements & contracts for clients

Develop solutions that meet clients' preferences, budget & requirements

Collaborate with internal team to ensure client's satisfaction on designs

Collect project details for handoff to project manager

Perform estimation for projects when necessary

Attend home trade shows throughout the year as required

Update & maintain up-to-date client information and communication within CRM

Attend project meetings and job showings as required

Build relationships with suppliers and sub-trades for future opportunities









Qualifications and Experience



Minimum 4- 5 years of sales experience in construction

Exceptional communication skills (Bilingualism is an asset)

Knowledge/ Experience with construction estimating practices

Understand construction documents & renovation costs




Must have:







Valid driver's license & personal vehicle




Nice to have:







Experience in professional sales presentations and quotes

Have an eye for residential designs and build solutions

Effective sales techniques

description:
Overview



CosmoProf, a Sally Beauty Holdings company, is currently searching for a driven, results-oriented sales professional to join our outside sales team.

At CosmoProf we dedicate ourselves to licensed beauty professionals in the salon industry and are committed to making our customers feel inspired to be their best. We don't just service the customer - we strive to provide an EPIC experience based on our four pillars: Education, Product, Inspiration and Community.

CosmoProf is currently seeking a 
Distributor Sales Consultant 
for the 
Calgary area




Overview Of The Role



Full time B2B (business to business) outside sales position in the Nova Scotia territory focused on growing sales through existing and new business. Service and support existing salon customers through business partnering, uncovering opportunities, providing product knowledge, coordinating education and planning promotions.



Core Competencies




 Responsibilities 



 Develop business plans in consultation with customers 

 Influential and goal-driven 

 Interested in the analytics to uncover opportunities 

 Highly organized and detail-oriented 

 Customer-focused and empathetic 

 Superior communication skills, both verbal and written 

 Advanced interpersonal skills allowing for great connections with customers, vendors and peers 

 Ability to prioritize and formulate efficiencies within the territory 

 Professional with strong business acumen 

 High level of integrity and accountable 

 Adaptable to changing circumstances 

 Self-motivated and able to work independently 




Candidate Requirements




 Qualifications 



 B2B outside sales experience 

 Valid driver's license 

 Reliable transportation 

 Valid passport 

 Computer literacy and familiarity with iPad 

 Salon industry experience very beneficial 

 Ability to travel for meetings, shows and other special events 

 Post-secondary education in business or related field would be an asset 




We Offer




 Competitive total compensation plan (bonus, incentives, trips, benefits, RRSP/DPSP) 

 Exclusive territory 

 T2200 for employment expenses 

 Employee discount 


We thank all qualified applicants and advise that only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

#Cosmoprof

About New Level Brewing





We are a musically inspired brewery with a DIY ethos. Our love of beer is combined with our love of fun and weird subcultures. 




We are committed to providing a safe, respectful and inclusive environment. 

 

We have always strived to brew weird beer for weird people, and to set ourselves apart in the craft beer industry by rejecting elitist culture of elitism and holding space for people who may not feel welcome elsewhere. 





​Core Values


​


1. It's Gotta Be Fun.
 Rather than worry about what is and isn't beer, the big question for NLB is whether or not it would be a good time. If we are having fun making it and selling it, then people will have fun drinking it and that's what matters to us. 

​


2. Dream it. Brew it.
 The amazing thing about beer is that even though it's ancient, we can still come up with new flavor profiles and brewing techniques. At NLB, nothing is necessarily off the table in terms of style or production methods. New Level means No Limits. 

​​


3. Craft is For Everyone.
 We take craft beer seriously and strive for the highest quality possible, but we are adamantly opposed to attempts to turn beer culture into another version of elitist wine culture. We hope that by brewing a wide array of styles that appeal to all sorts of people, that NLB can broaden the range of people who enjoy craft beer.





About the role





Our growing team is looking for an Edmonton based sales representative.

 

As a part of the NLB sales team, you will play a key role in building our retail presence in Northern Alberta. 




Your responsibilities will be challenging and varied, and will include maintaining and developing relationships with our current clients, generating leads for new accounts, following a route/schedule, cold calling, making the occasional delivery, communicating with the Calgary team, inputting data into our CRM software, and participating in beer related events. 




You will work with NLB’s Director of Sales, Sales Manager and various on-premise and off premise accounts throughout Edmonton and the surrounding area. Occasional travel to Calgary and other communities around Alberta will be required.




As our first Edmonton based team member, this role is best suited to someone with the combination of experience, ambition, organizational skills and accountability to effectively work independently. This role will be compensated through a combination of base salary and commission incentive. 






Ready to get started….?




Your days will be filled with...



Generating Leads

Maintaining and developing customer relationships

Fostering new relationships

Working events/tastings as needed

Meeting sales targets

Delivering product around the Edmonton area

Updating CRM software

Participating in sales team meetings

Cold calling

Acting as a brand ambassador and actively working to convert people to NLB Craft Beer

Presentation delivery and some public speaking

Processing Payments

Merchandising






To be successful in this position…



Experience in outside sales with a history of meeting sales targets

Have enthusiasm for Craft Beer and meeting new people

Effective communication and interpersonal skills

Pro-serve certification

Must be able to lift the occasional keg 

Clean driver’s abstract and valid driver’s license

Have your own vehicle

Fluency in Korean or Punjabi is an asset






NLB Team Member Qualities




Effective communicator 
- able to get your message across clearly and concisely in written and spoken English


Natural collaborator 
- able to quickly connect and build relationships with a diverse group of people, both in person and remotely


Tech savvy
 - confident in using, and keeping up to date with, a range of tools and technologies 


Self starter
 - able to work independently in a fast paced and innovating environment


Passionate and curious 
- you question the status quo, and are not afraid to try new ways of doing things


Committed to delivery
 - can balance multiple responsibilities; comfortably changing priorities while ensuring that deadlines are met


Inclusive and Respectful
 - actively contributes towards creating an inclusive, welcoming and safe work environment, where all of our people feel like they belong






You’ll love it here because...



Your role will be creative, varied and challenging. 

You’ll be a part of creating a culture which strives to be truly inclusive, where everyone can be themselves, and be empowered to thrive in the work that they do.

You’ll be working in an environment where your contributions will be valued and recognised. We will support you to grow your career with us, we’ll have regular, ongoing conversations with you about your performance and development needs.

We’ll support you to find a working arrangement that is right for you, and that enables you to find a balance between personal and work commitments.






Interested?




﻿



If you’re excited by what you have read, we would love to hear from you!

We’ve included the “wish list” of our ideal candidate above, but we realize that everyone comes to the table with a different background and skill set. If you are excited about the prospect of working for us, and can demonstrate that you can do most of what we’re looking for, we would welcome an application from you.



New Level Brewing is an equal opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive and safe work environment for people of all backgrounds.







While we thank all applicants, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.





To apply, please email the following to jillian@inclusionbylibra.com with the subject line 
APPLICATION: Edmonton Sales Representative






A resume outlining your most relevant experience

A cover letter, telling us a little more about you, and why you are interested in joining the New Level Brewing team.

Anything else that you think demonstrates why you would be a great addition to our team

Enjoy helping people? Love to work from home? Enjoy talking on the phone? 

Join our team! We are a collection of enthusiastic, driven and well educated professionals and we are looking to add you to our team! Do you have sales experience? In the leasing business? Or call center experience? We want you. 




The job is simple: Help our clients acquire the equipment they need for their business. CRM provided with over 10K clients that need equipment financing. We assist all types of clients from A-D credit in all types of industries. Don’t put yourself in one box. Help a friend start a restaurant and then help your uncle purchase his new truck!




The role is clear: to become a point person for our vendors and clients.

 

Part time position you make your own hours. 




We are looking for energetic and self-motivated people with the drive to go big. 




Our company has been in business for over 31 years and has helped hundreds of thousands of business dreams become reality. If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, contact us today.




This is an opportunity of a lifetime to work with us during this exciting growth period.

Will this be you who joins our team?

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security
description:
Climb Channel Solutions is seeking a highly motivated and driven Account Executive, Inside Sales who is looking to develop and grow professionally in today’s challenging IT Security industry. As a key member of the Canadian sales team, the AE will work with our top software vendors who are leaders in the Gartner Magic Quadrant to deliver innovative and advanced security solutions to our channel partners within their designated Territory. This is an excellent opportunity for a candidate with an entrepreneurial mindset who has a passion for IT Security/Technology and is ready to take charge in an exciting, stimulating career.




We invest in our employees and offer career advancement opportunities, professional development, vendor training & education and the right support to ensure you are successful in your role.




Apply Now--We're looking forward to reading your resume!




Duties & Responsibilities:





Responsible for a specific sales territory and managing inbound email requests, with an expectation of creating quotes and orders daily

Own the development and implementation of sales strategies to enable existing Value Added Resellers to expand their vendor mix

Maintain high-level expertise across the Vendors offered by Interwork with a strong focus on security and storage/disaster recovery

Engage in constant collaboration with our Vendors, build strong relationships with their sales team and launch joint go-to-market initiatives





Day-to-day activities may include any of the following:





Manage quote to order process

Assisting customers with maximizing upsell opportunities, such as extended maintenance, add-on sales, etc..

Provide best practice recommendations to prospective customers and channel partners, answer any sales/high-level vendor questions they may have
job_function: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description:
Cloudbeds is the hospitality industry's fastest-growing technology provider for independent hotels, hostels, vacation rentals, and hotel groups. Our award-winning Cloudbeds Hospitality Platform is currently helping a growing clientele of 22,000+ properties in 157 countries to increase revenue, streamline operations, and deliver memorable guest experiences.

Behind the Cloudbeds platform is a growing team of 500+ employees distributed across 40+ countries speaking 30+ languages. From data architects to UX designers, integrations managers to payments experts, former hotel managers to former OTA executives, our team comprises the brightest minds in technology and hospitality working to solve the industry’s biggest challenges.



This Means We



From the beginning, we've believed that our people are our greatest asset, so we've founded the company as #RemoteFirst, #RemoteAlways with shared that allows our team to thrive.


Hire the best people wherever they're located;

Emphasize the value of results over hours put in;

Provide flexibility in working hours and locations;

Foster an inclusive environment that celebrates bold thinking and diverse perspectives;

Offer open vacation policies, free LinkedIn Learning, and other benefits that promote well-being and professional development.


Together we're on a mission to power every property in the world and to do that, we need to find the best talent in the world. That's why we're on the search for a superstar Sales Development Representative.

As a Sales Development Representative, you will support the execution of an effective prospecting strategy focused on delivering qualified property owners to a demonstration.

Location: Remote (Canada)



What You Will Do




Generate leads lists from traditional and social media channels.

Identify prospect decision-makers, uncover critical business issues, stimulate interest and communicate Cloudbeds' value proposition.

Make and track 60+ phone calls per day within Salesforce CRM.

Connect with 15+ new contacts per day and track within Salesforce CRM.

Schedule demonstrations while making and tracking activities (email, phone, site visits).

Ensure a smooth hand-off of these leads to Market Managers.

Ensure 100% Salesforce (CRM) data integrity.

Enrich our Outbound marketing activities with your local market/cultural insights.

Stay current on industry issues/trends and competitive offerings.

May be required to prospect in-person locally and/or travel.

Other duties, as required.




You’ll Succeed With




Hotel/Hospitality/Travel Tech experience.

Demonstrable aptitude for sales.

Imagine a job with an excellent career growth potential. Excellent career possibilities exist between our seven business units comprised of 100 Canadian branches, plus Corporate career opportunities.




We are searching for an Inside Sales professional for our client's Wire and Cable Distributor division, Brampton branch. Duties include cold calling, opening accounts, building relationships and closing orders.




“
You build friendships and relationship with the customers. Our customers want to talk to us as they know we'll do what they need, you will know what they want."
 - quote from Inside Sales Rep.




Our client is a Business-to-Business (B2B) distribution of electrical products. They are the products and services source for electrical professionals whether they are building, renovating or maintaining Canada’s homes, businesses, factories and infrastructure.





What you will be doing



Sourcing, researching, and cold calling prospective clients

Contacting customers and identifying new products and potential up-selling.

Responding to and processing incoming calls and orders

Opening new accounts

Developing new customer base and sales leads by making cold and warm calls

Entering orders into system and expediting to ensure timely delivery

Maintaining knowledgebase on current products and learning about new products

Providing pricing quotations and follow-up on quotes





Concentration is on Commercial, Industrial, and Residential projects.





We need these skills & experiences:



1-3 years of related sales experience

Substantial demonstrable experience Cold Calling prospects

Wire and Cable product knowledge or industry experience

High School diploma

Strong organization skills and Microsoft Office knowledge required

A candidate that is willing to grow and learn the business will be given preference.






Do you also have these skills and experiences?



Automation or Electrical product knowledge or industry experience.

College diploma or certificate a definite advantage!






Compensation



Excellent base Salary + commission.

Group Benefits including medical with Vision Plan, RSP matching and education support





"
This place is really cool to work for
" - quote from Warehouse Associate





WHO OUR CLIENT IS


We have over 1,800 employees across 100 branches between our seven distinctive labels in Canada. Established in Canada in 1984, we have grown significantly thanks to organic growth and strategic acquisitions. Our businesses are each unique and we foster an opportunistic spirit in our company every day. We stay true to our entrepreneurial roots with our decentralized organizational structure and independently run divisions.




Each of our family companies are all independently run because our customers deserve personalized treatment, tailored to various industries and clientele. We understand that one size doesn’t fit all – we operate based on the needs of our customers and the ways that they do business. We serve the commercial, industrial, utility, and residential markets across the country. We pride ourselves on our values and place an emphasis on respect. Our customers, our suppliers and our employees are the heart of our company.




Green Performance: We've built a community of interest supporting eco-friendly behaviour and the creation and use of sustainable electricity. We are leading the initiative by being a reliable information source and facilitating online discussions.




Our client is an equal opportunity employer.





Our Policy


Thank you for taking the time to apply for this opportunity. We recognize the effort it takes. We review EVERY resume submitted. We would like to reply to each and every applicant, however, time simply does not permit it. We will reply to candidates whose resume matches the client's needs.





About Osler Business Consulting Ltd.


We are specialists in the Electrical Supplies/Distributor industry. We follow Sir William Osler's aphorism "The best preparation for tomorrow is to do today’s work superbly well." As such, we take our placements personal, as if we are the hiring company. Learn more about us here: www.Oslerhr.ca

Job Description



PEPSICO BEVERAGES CANADA - Full-Time Sales Representative – Vancouver



The Role:


As a Sales Representative for PepsiCo Beverages Canada, you will be maximizing business growth through the acquisition of new customers and maintenance of existing customer in various channels. You are responsible for growing the business in your territory by creating on-going, positive relationships with your customers.

This is a 
full-time
, permanent position.


What you’ll be working on:



Developing business to increase volume, new package distribution and acquiring new accounts using customized proposals

Selling and executing national and local promotions, soliciting placement of incremental marketing equipment, displays, racks and selling product inventory

Developing assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service

Utilizing point-of-sale materials to stimulate sales

Maintaining and increasing shelf facings and racks; cleaning shelving and racks; and rotating products

Providing excellent service to assigned accounts; creating and maintaining goodwill with all customers

Merchandising product sections and building displays to stimulate sales

Eliminating out-of-stocks and out-of-date product through effective order taking

Working closely with PBC delivery department to ensure effective service

Monitoring and reporting on competitive activity

Completing required paperwork and processes in an accurate and timely manner

Assisting with other supporting duties as assigned by Sales Manager




The Company


PepsiCo Canada is recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 employers. PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. Our product portfolio includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands; from Gatorade to Quaker, Tropicana to Lay’s and more. We make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.

At PepsiCo Canada, we are always centered on the consumer, developing exciting brand campaigns and continuously driving product innovations. Our people are our greatest asset! By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the company you want to work for!


Qualifications/Requirements



Who’s a good fit for the team:



You have completion of post-secondary education

You have a valid Driver’s License and reliable vehicle

1-2 years of direct selling experience is an asset

Food Service or Consumer Products experience is preferred

You have great analytical and organizational skills

You can work independently and with minimal supervision

You are proficient with Microsoft Suite

You have great oral presentation skills




What you can expect from us:



Competitive compensation, benefits, pension, RRSP contribution and vacation time

Mileage compensation

A flexible working environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance

A dynamic and inclusive culture that promotes you to bring your whole-self to work

A supportive team that will encourage your professional growth and development

An opportunity to be meaningful and impactful within your work and projects

 Full-Time

We are Play Hockey. Hockey is our passion, and we love helping young players reach their full potential. From our headquarters in Winnipeg, Manitoba, as well as our offices in Minnesota and Michigan, our veteran team of professionals delivers camps, clinics, leagues, teams, tournaments, and international tours to markets across North America. We strive to make a difference every day, act with integrity, and always love the game.




Do you have a passion for sports? We are seeking a crucial team player that is ready to roll-up their sleeves and help establish and expand the Inside Sales team for our fast-growing company. Play Hockey is seeking an outgoing, organized, motivated, individual with excellent communication skills to join our team as an 
Inside Sales Representative
. The role will work closely with Play Hockey’s General Manager as well as Regional Managers and other hockey operations staff. The Inside Sales Representative will focus on researching, prospecting, and pursuing customers with a focus on increasing the registration of Play Hockey’s exciting youth hockey tournaments. 





The position involves…





•	Having a strong understanding of Play Hockey’s events, tournaments, and value proposition  

•	Research and identify new potential customers

•	Prospecting and leveraging existing customer relationships 

•	Assisting customers with inquiries and connecting them with the appropriate Play Hockey team members both from a geographical and event type perspective

•	Working consistently in Play Hockey’s CRM system to maintain complete and accurate records of all client interactions

•	Managing accounts with regular outbound contact

•	Conducting customer satisfaction and follow up calls





Our ideal candidate will have…





•	Inside sales experience or an interest in building inside sales skills

•	Excellent communication skills, both speaking and writing

•	Strong customer focus and results oriented personality

•	Superior interpersonal and customer service skills to effectively build relationships

•	Demonstrated team-playing attitude

•	Strong time and self-management skills

•	High propensity to learn, and an ability to excel in a fast-paced work environment

•	Strong computer skills and proficient in the Microsoft Office Suite or Google Workspace

•	Hubspot experience is an asset

•	Location: Winnipeg, Manitoba




PLAY hockey is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

industries: Software Development, Environmental Services, and Internet Publishing
description:
Who Is FigBytes & How Are They Changing the World?





FigBytes is first a mission, a call to action - before they are a software company. Founded in 2013, FigBytes was a response from founders Ted and Sonam witnessing devastating breakdowns in our environment: the wildfires in California, cities in India running out of clean drinking water, rising pollution levels, and more.




They noticed enterprise organizations and governments move toward corporate social responsibility - tying their success metrics to the impact they have on the world around them (about time, they thought!)




But there was a missing piece to these admirable goals: Tracking them. How could these organizations quantify their sustainability, environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals and measure their progress towards said goals? From these needs, FigBytes was born. Their cloud-based platform allows customers to embed their ESG objectives and metrics into their performance, strategy and brand. They transform data into real-time storytelling, removing data complexity so customers can focus on what truly matters - meeting their ESG goals. 




Since environmental sustainability is both impacting and impacted by just about everyone, FigBytes serves a large and diverse market. Their priority segments include consumer goods, hotels/resorts, financial services, technology, oil & gas, and government entities such as states and municipalities. With clients such as the State of Minnesota, AECOM, City of Phoenix, University of Alberta, McDermott, Ford, TongaatHulett, and more, FigBytes stands on solid ground to arm global entities with the means to achieve mission-critical ESG objectives. 




With a combination of VC and government funding, FigBytes is in the perfect opportunity to have an impact on a fast-growing organization.





How Will I Make An Impact?





Reporting to the VP of Sales, your role is critical in ensuring FigBytes achieves its growth targets. As our first dedicated Sales Development Representative, you will take on all things related to developing net new leads with our enterprise customer market, which includes:





Actively seeking out new customers by cold calling to businesses across North America.

Completing 60+ outbound calls per day or 2+ hours of talk time.

Developing relationships with prospects to identify revenue opportunities and broaden their knowledge of our product offering.

Respond to all/any incoming customer inquiries.

Qualify potential leads and transfer them to Senior Account Executives as needed

Help develop and maintain a database of qualified leads, through referrals, telephone canvassing, cold calling, email, and networking.

Maximize all opportunities in the process of closing a sale.

Execute the daily operational, day-to-day goals and priorities assigned by the manager.

Adhere to company policies, and understand procedures and concepts of deal structure and strategy.

Provide excellent customer service to our clients and maintain high standards.






The ideal candidate will have the following:






A desire to build a career in enterprise software sales

Willingness and the ability to pick up the phone and start conversations with strangers all day

Ambition 

Openness to learning

Empathy

Resilience

Outside the box thinking

Problem-solving

Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment and ever-evolving industry

Customer centricity

Strong verbal and written communication skills

Team player

Entrepreneurial way of thinking

Leadership! Leadership! Leadership!

Overachieving mentality





This is a remote position. Candidates living in Canada are welcome to apply. If this opportunity speaks to you, we would love to meet you!

Job Summary:


The prime candidate would have exceptional customer service skills to assist customers in placing orders via phone and email. Entering orders in our Traverse program system, processing payments on a POS System, Process shipping quotes and shipping the orders.





Duties will include:



Customer interactions

Answering phone calls and reply to emails

Processing orders on our Traverse/CRM Program

Using excel to enter data

Accessing shipping logins to obtain quotes and process shipments

Using FedEx, Purolator, UPS, etc.

Processing payments on POS

General office administrative work as required

Following up on Accounts Receivable

Processing domestic and international orders






Required Skills:



Works well independently

Exhibits a pleasant and friendly disposition with colleagues and all external contacts

Ability to maintain calm in a busy, challenging environment

Proficiency in Microsoft office 365 (word, excel, outlook)






Qualifications:



Completion of high school diploma

2-3 years related experience

Shipping experience would be considered an asset

French or Spanish speaking would be considered an asset

Job Description



Route Sales Representative



The Role:


As a Route Sales Representative, there are two main accountabilities: (1) selling and developing the business and (2) servicing customers through delivery and merchandising. You will be responsible for developing and sustaining a growing snack foods business to an assigned group of retail customers, for example, grocery, gas and convenience stores.


The Company:


PepsiCo Canada is recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 employers. PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. Our product portfolio includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands; from Gatorade to Quaker, Tropicana to Lay’s and more. We make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world. PepsiCo's effort to help build a more sustainable food system represents a key element of the company's broader vision of accelerated, sustainable growth known as Winning with Purpose. As part of this vision, PepsiCo is striving to be a better company by further integrating purpose into the core of its business and brands and doing even more for people and the planet. Our purpose efforts include fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, supporting the communities where we live and work, and improving choices in our portfolio through reformulations and new products.

At PepsiCo Canada, we are focused on delighting our consumers by delivering high-quality products and exciting brand campaigns. Our people are critical to our success and by supporting their personal growth and development and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, PepsiCo Canada is a company you’ll be proud to join!


What you’ll be working on:



Identifying changing customer needs through a constant review of the highest selling products

Frequent communication with store managers

Developing all assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service objectives

Selling and executing national and local promotions, soliciting placement of incremental marketing equipment, displays, racks and selling product inventory for customer volume demands

Managing inventory to ensure balanced accounts and fresh products for customers

Executing hands on activities: managing product placement on shelves, increasing shelf facings and racks, handling carton returns, inventory movement and cleaning shelving and racks




Qualifications/Requirements



Who’s a good fit for the team:



High School diploma required, University/College education is an asset

Valid full G driver’s license or class 5 driver’s license

A car or reliable, consistent access to a car and a clear/clean driving record

Scheduling flexibility: work schedule can vary (weekends/holidays included)

Previous sales experience with a consumer-packaged goods or retail organization preferred

Outstanding organizational skills (able to handle multiple priorities, problem solve, meet targets

Great with people and excellent communication skills




What you can expect from us:



Competitive compensation, benefits, pension, RRSP contribution and vacation time

A flexible working environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance

A dynamic and inclusive culture that promotes you to bring your whole-self to work

A supportive team that will encourage your professional growth and development

An opportunity to be meaningful and impactful within your work and projects

An opportunity to give back to the community with our Always on Volunteer 360 Program

An organization that aims to use their scale, reach and expertise to build a more sustainable world

description:
Ceridian is a global leader in Human Capital Management technology. Simply put, we allow our customers to do the most complex things well (HR, Payroll, Benefits Administration, Workforce Management and Talent Management) and do them to scale.

Makes Work Life Better™ is our brand promise, not only to our customers, but to our employees as well. Our flagship platform, Dayforce, helps leaders make smart decisions based on data, strategy and intelligence that create value and maximize productivity.

How do we make work life better?


 By delivering an award-winning product, conceptualized and developed by award-winning leaders, that result in award-winning customer employee experiences 

 By hiring highly innovative, diverse talent that fully embraces and embodies our core values in everything they do: Customer Focus, Equity, Shared Ambition, Agility, Transparency, Optimism 

 By using modern technology, such as voice-activation with Dayforce Assistant and access to your money as soon as you earn it with Dayforce Wallet to stay in rhythm with the evolving demands of our 4 million global users 

 We understand that no matter where you are, choosing a new employer is always one of life’s most stressful events. We encourage you to check us out at Ceridian.com to learn more about how we are impacting the world of work for our customers, employees and you!


Location
: For this role, we are open to remote work, and can hire anywhere in Sydney or Melbourne



About The Opportunity



Reporting into the Head of Sales ANZ the Enterprise Sales Representative is responsible for selling Dayforce HCM solutions to large complex companies in their assigned vertical or geography. As an industry specialist and a member of the ANZ sales team you will not only sell, but help customers take a lead in their transformation journey, supported by Ceridian’s deep industry expertise and experience of managing similar customer journeys across different industry verticals. You will also be pivotal in developing solutions for clients that include increased agility, insightful decision-making, and strong return on investment.

While this sales role is primarily focused on selling new business, the Enterprise Sales Representative may also be responsible for selling to existing clients.



What You’ll Get To Do





 Establish deep, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts 

 Pipeline development through a combination of phone calls, social & email campaigns, and market sector knowledge/intelligence 

 Create and maintain a sales pipeline to hit and surpass goals within designated market sectors 

 Engage with prospect organizations to position Dayforce HCM solutions through strategic value-based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references, and analyst data 

 Generate short-term results whilst maintaining long-term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation 

 Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery 

 Understand the competitive landscape and customer needs so you can effectively position Dayforce HCM offerings 

 Tactical Sales focus 





What’s In It For You





 Encouragement to be the best version of yourself at and away from work: 


 YOUnity diversity and inclusion programs 

 Amazing time away from work programs 


 Support for your total well-being through our Live Well, Work Well programs targeting all aspects of your life 

 Recognition for your contributions through excellent pay, perks, and rewards 

 Giving where you’re living: volunteer days, Ceridian sponsored events, and our very own charity, Ceridian Cares 

 Opportunities to fuel your career growth through numerous internal and external programs and events 





Skills And Experience We Value





 Ability to quickly develop a deep knowledge of customer’s business and discuss issues from multiple angles – driven by genuine curiosity 

 Adept at driving two-way communication by clearly articulating value proposition and teaching to customer’s pain points – leading by providing customers with new insights 

 Ability to offer unique perspective by reframing and challenging the way customers view their business; know how to structure a sales pitch to highlight customer benefits before supplier strengths 

 Very strong pipeline and account management experience 

 Ability to communicate on C-level and experience selling to senior level business owners or Directors is a strong asset – as well as being grounded when dealing with detail/operational issues 

 Existing industry experience selling complex SaaS solutions highly desirable 

 Experience developing a territory 

 Established credibility to influence at the highest levels 

 Ability to quickly develop a deep knowledge of customer’s business and discuss issues from multiple angles – driven by genuine curiosity 

 Understanding complex decision-making process and can influence key decision makers 

 Lead the account planning process that develops account strategy, financial targets, and critical milestones 

 Lead and manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as our solution architects, implementation, and account management teams 

 Defining appropriate Dayforce HCM value propositions and driving the implementation of sales and marketing campaigns 

 Create and maintain partnerships with appropriate professional/industry focused organisations 





Minimum Qualifications





 Experience selling high end software solutions, SaaS consulting/managed services to enterprise and mid-market companies 

 Proven success hitting 1+ mil revenue targets 

 Experience developing territories 

 Very Strong pipeline and account management experience 

 Highly developed sense of accountability 

 Team player/ collaborator 

 Brand ambassador (transformation agent) 

 Engaging/inclusive influencer 

 Hungry for knowledge/continuous progress 

 Authoritative 

 High energy/activity levels 

 Passionate, driven by high performance standards 



Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider and embrace ALL individuals and what makes them unique. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success. We encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions.

We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. If you are selected for an interview, you will be contacted by a Ceridian Recruiter with a @ceridian.com email directly from our organization.

Apply Now
